Fix TUI crash on window maximize

Root cause: Buffer overrun during alt buffer resize when dimensions
were updated before buffer was swapped. Other threads accessing
cells would pass bounds checks \(using new dimensions\) but access
the old smaller buffer.

Fixes:
- Swap buffer BEFORE updating dimensions in alt buffer resize
- Create fresh empty buffer for alt buffer resize \(TUI apps redraw
  after SIGWINCH anyway\)
- Add thread-safe GetDimensions\(\) method
- Return Cell by value from GetCellWithScrollback to prevent
  dangling references
- Add extra bounds check against actual buffer size
- Defer ScreenBuffer resize until after DX12 renderer stabilizes
- Skip frames after resize to let TUI apps process SIGWINCH
- Add stricter codepoint validation to skip garbage values

Bash(git -C C:/Users/maxla/TerminalDX12 commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix additional race condition in ClearLine/ClearRect

ClearLine and ClearRect were missing mutex locks, causing crashes
when the VT thread cleared lines while the main thread was resizing:

1. VT thread calls ClearLine, iterates x=0 to 79
2. Main thread resizes buffer from 80x24 to 40x12
3. VT thread accesses m_buffer[1919] but buffer only has 480 cells

Fix:
- Add mutex lock to ClearLine\(int y\)
- Add mutex lock to ClearLine\(int y, int startX, int endX\)
- Add mutex lock to ClearRect
- Add ClearLineInternal helper for use within locked context
- Add extra bounds check before buffer access

This completes the fix for #2 \(window maximize crash\).
